definition.name: NXgoniometer
definition.doc: Goniometer angles used during a measurement. The goniometers used at neutron and x-ray facilities are typically four-circle or six-circle goniometers, or variants of either one. There are a number of conventions defining the names of these angles, so the group should contain a :ref:`NXcite` group, which provides links relevant to this goniometer.

group.name: convention
group.doc: A reference to a publication or online documentation that describe the convention used in this group to define the names of angles.

field.name: goniometer
field.doc: The common name for the type of goniometer used in these measurements.

field.name: xs
field.doc: The translation of the sample from the center of rotation along the x-axis defined by the local coordinate system.

field.name: ys
field.doc: The translation of the sample from the center of rotation along the y-axis defined by the local coordinate system.

field.name: zs
field.doc: The translation of the sample from the center of rotation along the z-axis defined by the local coordinate system.
